column4: EU's Almunia denies decision on Google was postponed to appease lobbyists
column5: BRUSSELS Europe's antitrust chief hit back on Friday at media reports suggesting that he had bowed to political lobbying by delaying a final decision on alleged anti-competitive behavior by Google.

column4: EU's Almunia denies decision on Google was postponed to appease lobbyists
column5: BRUSSELS  Sept 12 Europe's antitrust chief hit back on Friday at media reports suggesting that he had bowed to political lobbying by delaying a final decision on alleged anti-competitive behaviour by Google.

column4: US STOCKS-Wall St falls in afternoon; set to snap 5 weeks of gains
column5: NEW YORK  Sept 12 U.S. stocks were lower in afternoon trading on Friday  with energy shares extending recent losses after the Treasury department announced new sanctions against Russia.

column5: NEW YORK  Sept 12 U.S. stocks were lower at midday on Friday  with energy shares extending recent losses after the Treasury department announced new sanctions against Russia.

column5: NEW YORK  Sept 12 Shares of eBay Inc  rose about 4 percent in heavy volume on Friday  with two European-based traders and one U.S.-based trader citing rumors that Google Inc would possibly take a large stake in eBay as the reason for the move.

column4: FAA penalizes five companies for safety  hazmat violations
column5: The U.S. Federal Aviation Administration proposed a combined total of more than $430 000 in penalties for five companies on Friday  including FedEx Corp  British Airways and a unit of American Airlines Group  for alleged violations of safety and hazardous material regulations.

column4: FAA penalizes five companies for safety  hazmat violations

column4: UPDATE 1-Energy & Exploration Partners files for IPO again
column5: Sept 12 Energy & Exploration Partners Inc has filed with U.S. regulators for an initial public offering of common stock  its second attempt to list on the New York Stock Exchange.

column4: Apple gets a failing grade for Canadian geography
column5: TORONTO Geography has again stumped Apple Inc  with the technology company mixing up and relocating both Canada's largest city and its national capital on a map showing when different parts of the country can expect new iPhone deliveries.

column4: Apple gets a failing grade for Canadian geography
column5: TORONTO  Sept 12 Geography has again stumped Apple Inc  with the technology company mixing up and relocating both Canada's largest city and its national capital on a map showing when different parts of the country can expect new iPhone deliveries.

column4: Larger Apple iPhone shipments delayed amid record orders
column5: Customers may have to wait three to four weeks to get their hands on Apple Inc's  iPhone 6 Plus  after a record number of orders for the company's latest smartphones strained available supply.

column4: UPDATE 2-Larger Apple iPhone shipments delayed amid record orders
column5: Sept 12 Customers may have to wait three to four weeks to get their hands on Apple Inc's iPhone 6 Plus  after a record number of orders for the company's latest smartphones strained available supply.

column4: New iPhone 6 Plus pre-order shipments to be delayed by a month
column5: Sept 12 Many customers will have to wait three to four weeks to get their hands on Apple Inc's larger screen iPhone 6 Plus after pre-orders for Sept. 19 delivery were booked out within hours.

column4: China's iPhone delay gives smugglers reason to cheer
column5: HONG KONG The likely delayed launch of Apple Inc's  new iPhone 6 in China  the world's biggest smartphone market  sparked a race to pre-order the phone in Hong Kong on Friday.

column4: Earthy elegance at Ralph Lauren tops off New York Fashion Week
column5: NEW YORK Ralph Lauren capped a week of New York fashion shows on Thursday with a collection that mixed and matched a desert-inspired palette with fluid silks and glistening beads in what one observer praised as "safari goes glam." | Video

column4: Scottish leader Salmond demands RBS leak investigation
column5: LONDON Scottish nationalist leader Alex Salmond demanded an investigation into what he said was an attempt by Britain's government to scare voters out of backing independence next week and which  he said  broke financial market rules.

column5: A federal judge has ruled in favor of Sony Corp in a long-running case  overturning a jury verdict for L-3 Communications Corp [LLLCO.UL] and invalidating several parts of an image sensor patent held by the defense contractor.

column4: Nigeria's AMCON chooses HISL as buyer for nationalised lender Enterprise
column5: LAGOS  Sept 12 Nigeria's state-owned rescue bank AMCON has selected HBCL Investment Services Limited (HISL)  a private commercial bank  as the successful bidder to buy nationalised lender Enterprise Bank  AMCON said.
